texts: I remember our captain obsessed with treasure, that wouldn't be a problem, but we constantly faced death because of his obsession.
We came to Brazil because there was evidence that the captain's treasure was here,  expected to find Roque Brasiliano, a brazilian pirate, but i didn't find him.
Your idiot Roque Brasiliano is Dutch, he just spent a lot of time here in Brazil ... and apparently we will also pass
Our captain said that the treasure will be divided precisely  between us, not least because the pirate code says it, but it  is fair to lose half the crew as a result.
Bloody English corsair drinker of tea, we've lost a lot of our  own, we've lost a lot of things, and we're nowhere near the treasure.
We fell but they fell too but the corsair continues, how is that possible?
It's cold, it's dark, but it looks calm, am I alive?
There are many slaves in Brazil, I even saw a ship full of men, women, children and the elderly, some of whom seem to have been thrown overboard.

We want all that treasure, but will it worth it? Guess now, if you have offered a slave all that treasure in exchange for his life and freedom, what would he choose? Wealth or liberty? Such a dilemma...
Find the eight pieces immediately, i need all of them, find them so we can get out of this damn place.
What's going on, why is his obsession with these crap, what are they?
We finally found all the pieces, but...
A Black man, what do you want from me?
Just this skull made of jade behind you. Wait... how i can understand you?? And speak this weird language?!
Huuuum... I need this skull to find a specific treasure, but... judging by your surprise with the language, I suppose have found him first.
The piece of Eight, that's the name! Let's make a deal, give me all that jewelry and I will let you through, will you?
